title: David Harbour transforms into Oscar the Grouch in faux SNL trailer inspired by Joker
text:
Stranger Things star David Harbour transformed into Oscar the Grouch in a faux Joker-style trailer during this week's episode of NBC's Saturday Night Live.

The 44-year-old SAG Award winner's character was a silly cross between the surly green Sesame Street Muppet and Joaquin Phoenix in Todd Phillips' hit drama.

Painted as a gritty anti-hero origin story, David's Oscar is a grouchy garbage man who admits he 'kind of likes trash' to his horrified co-worker.

Parody: Stranger Things star David Harbour transformed into Oscar the Grouch in a faux Joker-style trailer during this week's episode of NBC's Saturday Night Live

Mash-up: The 44-year-old SAG Award winner's character was a silly cross between the surly green Sesame Street Muppet and Joaquin Phoenix in Todd Phillips' hit drama.

Like in Joker, Oscar goes to a therapist where he laments: 'Is it me, or are things getting worse out there? Hookers and pimps on every corner.'

In this Gotham version of Sesame Street, Muppets like Big Bird, The Count, Cookie Monster, Elmo, and Burt & Ernie are darker, grittier versions of themselves.

After the therapist asks Oscar how it makes him feel, he replied: 'Grouchy. If everyone calls you trash and everyone treats you like trash, why don't you just become trash?'

Brought to life: Painted as a gritty anti-hero origin story, David's Oscar is a grouchy garbage man who admits he 'kind of likes trash' to his horrified co-worker

Like in Joker, Oscar goes to a therapist where he laments: 'Is it me, or are things getting worse out there? Hookers and pimps on every corner'

Partners in crime: In this Gotham version of Sesame Street, Muppets like Big Bird, The Count, Cookie Monster, Elmo, and Burt & Ernie (pictured) are darker, grittier versions of themselves

The parody preview ends with Oscar standing in front of a vanity mirror presumably at a talk show and asks: 'Would you call me the Grouch?'

The parody preview ends with Oscar standing in front of a vanity mirror presumably at a talk show and asks: 'Would you call me the Grouch?'

Joker currently holds a 90% audience approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes and it has impressively amassed $306.9M at the global box office since opening last weekend.
description: The 44-year-old Stranger Things star's character was a silly cross between the surly green Sesame Street Muppet and Joaquin Phoenix in Todd Phillips' hit drama
